title: Relates to the time to commence certain medical malpractice actions
summary: Relates to the time to commence certain medical malpractice actions; provides that actions related to acts or omissions of hospitals where an incident report is required to be filed may be filed within one year of the required filing.

       AN  ACT  to amend the civil practice law and rules and the public health
         law, in relation to the time to commence certain malpractice actions

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  214-a  of  the  civil practice law and rules, as
    2  amended by chapter 485 of the laws  of  1986,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    S  214-a.  Action  for  medical, dental or podiatric malpractice to be
    5  commenced within two years and six months; exceptions.   (A)  An  action
    6  for  medical,  dental  or podiatric malpractice must be commenced within
    7  two years and six months of the act, omission or failure  complained  of
    8  or  last  treatment  where  there  is  continuous treatment for the same
    9  illness, injury or condition which gave rise to the said  act,  omission
   10  or failure[; provided, however, that where].
   11    (B) (1) NOTWITHSTANDING SUBDIVISION (A) OF THIS SECTION, AN ACTION FOR
   12  MEDICAL,  DENTAL  OR  PODIATRIC MALPRACTICE NEED NOT BE COMMENCED WITHIN
   13  TWO YEARS AND SIX MONTHS OF THE ACT, OMISSION OR FAILURE  COMPLAINED  OF
   14  OR  LAST  TREATMENT  WHERE  THERE  IS  CONTINUOUS TREATMENT FOR THE SAME
   15  ILLNESS, INJURY OR CONDITION WHICH GAVE RISE TO THE SAID  ACT,  OMISSION
   16  OR FAILURE, IF THE DEFENDANT IS A HOSPITAL AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION TEN
   17  OF  SECTION  TWENTY-EIGHT  HUNDRED ONE OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW, AND HAS
   18  FAILED TO FILE AN INCIDENT REPORT AS REQUIRED  BY  SECTION  TWENTY-EIGHT
   19  HUNDRED  FIVE-L  OF SUCH LAW IN CONNECTION WITH THE INCIDENT THAT IS THE
   20  SUBJECT OF THE MALPRACTICE ACTION. IN  SUCH  CASE,  THE  ACTION  MAY  BE
   21  COMMENCED WITHIN ONE YEAR OF THE DATE OF THE REQUIRED FILING.
   22    (2)  NOTWITHSTANDING  SUBDIVISION  (A)  OF THIS SECTION, AN ACTION FOR
   23  MEDICAL, DENTAL OR PODIATRIC MALPRACTICE NEED NOT  BE  COMMENCED  WITHIN
   24  TWO  YEARS  AND SIX MONTHS OF THE ACT, OMISSION OR FAILURE COMPLAINED OF

    1  OR LAST TREATMENT WHERE THERE  IS  CONTINUOUS  TREATMENT  FOR  THE  SAME
    2  ILLNESS,  INJURY  OR CONDITION WHICH GAVE RISE TO THE SAID ACT, OMISSION
    3  OR FAILURE, WHERE SUCH ACTION IS AGAINST A HOSPITAL AS DEFINED IN SUBDI-
    4  VISION TEN OF SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED ONE OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW,
    5  REGARDLESS OF WHETHER SUCH ACTION IS OTHERWISE BARRED BY SUBDIVISION (A)
    6  OF THIS SECTION AGAINST ANY INDIVIDUAL LICENSED UNDER TITLE EIGHT OF THE
    7  EDUCATION  LAW, WHERE EITHER SUCH INDIVIDUAL OR SUCH HOSPITAL HAS FAILED
    8  TO FILE AN INCIDENT REPORT AS REQUIRED BY SECTION  TWENTY-EIGHT  HUNDRED
    9  FIVE-L  OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW IN CONNECTION WITH THE INCIDENT THAT IS
   10  THE SUBJECT OF THE MALPRACTICE ACTION. IN SUCH CASE, THE ACTION  MAY  BE
   11  COMMENCED WITHIN ONE YEAR OF THE DATE OF THE REQUIRED FILING.
   12    (C)  WHERE  the action is based upon the discovery of a foreign object
   13  in the body of the patient, the action may be commenced within one  year
   14  of the date of such discovery or of the date of discovery of facts which
   15  would  reasonably  lead to such discovery, whichever is earlier. For the
   16  purpose of this  section  the  term  "continuous  treatment"  shall  not
   17  include  examinations  undertaken  at the request of the patient for the
   18  sole purpose of ascertaining the state of the patient's  condition.  For
   19  the  purpose of this section the term "foreign object" shall not include
   20  a chemical compound, fixation device or prosthetic aid or device.
   21    S 2.  Subdivisions 4 and 5 of section 2805-l of the public health law,
   22  subdivision 5 as renumbered by chapter 632 of  the  laws  of  2006,  are
   23  renumbered subdivisions 5 and 6 and a new subdivision 4 is added to read
   24  as follows:
   25    4.   NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, COPIES OF ANY REPORTS
   26  SUBMITTED TO THE DEPARTMENT UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL ALSO SIMULTANEOUSLY
   27  BE SUBMITTED TO:
   28    (A) THE PATIENT OR PATIENTS WHO ARE AFFECTED IN SUCH A  MANNER  AS  TO
   29  TRIGGER  THE  REPORTING  REQUIREMENTS  AS  SET  FORTH  IN PARAGRAPHS (A)
   30  THROUGH (G) OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION;
   31    (B) IN THE EVENT  THE  PATIENT  IS  DECEASED  OR  INCAPACITATED,  SUCH
   32  REPORTS  SHALL  BE SUBMITTED WITH THE PATIENT'S OR ESTATE'S LEGAL REPRE-
   33  SENTATIVE; AND
   34    (C) THE PERSON, FAMILY OR OTHERWISE, WHO HAS BEEN  IDENTIFIED  IN  THE
   35  HOSPITAL'S  RECORDS HAS THE PERSON DESIGNATED BY THE PATIENT FOR NOTIFI-
   36  CATION OR CONSULTATION IN THE  EVENT  OF  THE  PATIENT'S  INCAPACITY  OR
   37  DEATH.
   38    S  3. The public health law is amended by adding two new sections 2823
   39  and 2824 to read as follows:
   40    S 2823. LIABILITY  OF  HOSPITALS  FOR  INFECTIONS;  PRIVATE  RIGHT  OF
   41  ACTION.  ANY  PERSON,  WHO  IN  THE  COURSE OF A TREATMENT, PROCEDURE OR
   42  DELIVERY OF HEALTH CARE SERVICE, BY ANY HOSPITAL AS DEFINED IN  SUBDIVI-
   43  SION  TEN  OF  SECTION  TWENTY-EIGHT  HUNDRED  ONE  OF  THIS ARTICLE, IS
   44  SUBJECTED TO A HOSPITAL ACQUIRED INFECTION AS DEFINED BY  PARAGRAPH  (A)
   45  OF  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  SECTION  TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED NINETEEN OF THIS
   46  ARTICLE, MAY BRING A CAUSE OF ACTION FOR  ANY  INJURIES  SUFFERED  AS  A
   47  RESULT  OF  SUCH  INFECTION,  PURSUANT TO THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS SET
   48  FORTH IN SECTION TWO HUNDRED FOURTEEN-A OF THE CIVIL  PRACTICE  LAW  AND
   49  RULES.
   50    S  2824.  STRICT  LIABILITY  FOR  MEDICATION  ERRORS; PRIVATE RIGHT OF
   51  ACTION. EVERY HOSPITAL, AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION TEN OF  SECTION  TWEN-
   52  TY-EIGHT  HUNDRED  ONE OF THIS ARTICLE, IS STRICTLY LIABLE FOR ANY INJU-
   53  RIES SUFFERED TO ANY PATIENT AS A RESULT OF AN ERROR IN PROVIDING  MEDI-
   54  CATION  TO  SAID  PATIENT  IN  THE  COURSE  OF A TREATMENT, PROCEDURE OR
   55  DELIVERY OF HEALTH CARE SERVICE.
   56    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
